snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Monday's selection includes stagnant printing revenue at Hewlett-Packard, a hologrammatic assistant that gives travelers directions and Google...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Monday's selection includes stagnant printing revenue at Hewlett-Packard, a hologrammatic assistant that gives travelers directions and Google avoiding $2 billion in taxes in 2011 by shifting revenue to a subsidiary in Bermuda.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: IPhone 5S Alert, and Google's Bermuda Money
